to O
Amazon O
https://www.amazonbookreview.com O
July O
2017 O
Amazon O
owns O
a O
blog O
amazonbookreview.com O
which O
is O
used O
to O
improve O
the O
book O
sales O
in O
amazon.com O
. O

It O
was O
recently O
hosted O
in O
a O
3rd O
party O
blogging O
platform O
TypePad O
. O

- O
The O
project O
required O
to O
find O
a O
platform O
which O
satisfies O
all O
the O
requirements O
and O
transfer O
all O
TypePad O
content O
to O
the O
Amazon O
owned O
platform O
while O
maintaining O
its O
functionalities O
and O
compatibility O
. O

. O

Mobile O
Widget O
Disparity O
July O
2017 O
https://www.linkedin.com/in/shreyanshu-gupta-135176103/ O
https://www.amazonbookreview.com O
- O

to O

in O

files O

Description O
: O
CBIL O
( O
Core O
Banking O
Integration O
Layer O
) O
is O
a O
crucial O
integration O
layer O
that O
is O
specifically O
addressing O
the O
architectural O
complexity O
due O
to O
multiple O
core O
banking O
systems O
and O
variants O
at O
HSBC O
. O

It O
is O
a O
standard O
service O
interface O
across O
different O
core O
banking O
systems O
to O
facilitate O
easy O
integration O
with O
other O
global O
systems O
. O

CBIL O
is O
a O
strategic O
initiative O
to O
standardize O
all O
interfaces O
with O
core O
banking O
without O
impacting O
the O
underlying O
core O
banking O
system O
. O

DESCRIPTION O
• O
IPv6 O
, O
formerly O
named O
IPng O
( O
next O
generation O
) O
, O
is O
the O
latest O
version O
of O
the O
Internet O
Protocol O
( O
IP O
) O
. O

IP O
is O
a O
packet O
- O
based O
protocol O
used O
to O
exchange O
data O
, O
voice O
, O
and O
video O
traffic O
over O
digital O
networks O
• O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
- O
Area O
Application O
Services O
IPv4 O
users O
can O
move O
to O
IPv6 O
and O
receive O
services O
such O
as O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
security O
, O
quality O
of O
service O
( O
QoS O
) O
, O
and O
globally O
unique O
addresses O
. O

The O

address O
space O

the O
need O
for O
private O
addresses O
and O
Network O
Address O
Translation O
( O
NAT O
) O
processing O
by O
border O

at O

edges O
. O

• O

in O
the O
Cisco O
IOS O
software O
consists O
of O
assigning O

addresses O
to O
individual O
router O
interfaces O
. O

The O

of O

• O

. O

RELEASES O
LANCER O
, O
PHOENIX O
, O
SKYHAWK O
, O
SPRIT O
DESCRIPTION O
• O
Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
is O
a O
Cisco O
Systems O
technology O
that O
improves O
the O
performance O
of O
applications O
on O
a O
wide O
area O
network O
( O
WAN O
) O
. O

WAAS O
combines O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
Area O
File O
Services O
( O
WAFS O
- O
products O
allow O
remote O
office O
users O
to O
access O
and O
share O
files O
globally O
at O
LAN O
speeds O
over O
the O
WAN O
) O
with O
WAN O
optimization O
inside O
of O
a O
router O
, O
accelerating O
TCP O
- O
based O
applications O
on O
a O
given O
network O
. O

• O
WAAS O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
devices O
called O
wide O
area O
application O
engines O
( O
WAEs O
) O
that O
work O
together O
to O
optimize O
TCP O
traffic O
over O
your O
network O
. O

When O
client O
and O
server O
applications O
attempt O
to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
, O
the O
network O
intercepts O
and O
redirects O
this O
traffic O
to O
the O
WAEs O
so O
that O
they O
can O
act O
on O
behalf O
of O
the O
client O
application O
and O
the O
destination O
server O
. O

• O
The O
WAEs O
examine O
the O
traffic O
and O
use O
built O
- O
in O
application O
policies O
to O
determine O
whether O
to O
optimize O
the O
traffic O
or O
allow O
it O
to O
pass O
through O
your O
network O
un O
optimized O
• O
Mainly O
involves O
optimizing O
the O
various O
Ao O
's O
like O
HTTP O
, O
SSL O
, O
HTTPS O
and O
functional O
wise O
platform O
check O
. O

Infosys O
Limited O

October O
2010 O
to O
May O
2012 O
Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O
. O

Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O
. O

Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O
. O

Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O
. O

Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O
. O

This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O
. O

: O
• O

a O
performance O
certificates O
and O
given O
a O
bonus O
for O
outstanding O
performance O

opportunity O
for O

and O

environment O
at O

Project O
: O
PoPs O
( O

System O
) O
facilitates O
the O

of O

/ O

/ O

/ O

. O

of O

, O

. O

, O

BT O
Openreach O
( O
British O

) O
BT O
Openreach O
is O
responsible O
for O
looking O
after O
the O
local O
network O
( O
connection O
from O
your O
property O
to O
local O
exchange O
) O
that O

the O

of O
telecommunication O
services O
possible O
. O

BT O
helps O
to O
provide O
lines O
for O
telephone O
connection O
. O

It O
has O
products O
like O
PSTN O
, O
Ethernet O
, O
NGA O
, O
and O
LLU O
. O

BT O
acts O
as O
an O
intermediate O
between O
customer O
and O
connection O
provider O
. O

BT O
Openreach O
is O
a O
software O
module O
which O
manages O
BT O
business O
right O
from O
the O
placement O
of O
the O
order O
, O

, O

status O
to O

. O

. O

by O

and O

is O

. O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O
which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O
Banking O
Supervision O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O
create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O
how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O
risks O
banks O
face O
. O

In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O
and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O
appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O
. O

The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O
requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O
. O

For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O
( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O
Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O
. O

If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O
approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O
. O

Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O
. O

Software O
Used O
: O
Oracle O
9i O

PROJECT O
SUMMARY O
- O
BOOMI O
Project O
Name O
Success O
factor O
integration O
with O
Sterling O
Client O
SYSCO O
Employer O
Infosys O
Limited O
Role O
Developer U-Designation
Team O
Size O
3 O
members O
Technologies O
Java O
script O
, O
groovy O
script O
, O
SuccessFactor O
, O
Sterling O
, O
Webservice O
Duration O
2 O
years O
Project O
Abstract O
: O
https://www.indeed.com/r/Yogi-Pesaru/2ed7aded59ecf425?isid=rex-download&ikw=download-top&co=IN O
The O
integration O
for O
Sterling O
is O
a O
two O
- O
way O
integration O
to O
support O
the O
investigation O
and O
confirm O
accuracy O
of O
background O
information O
provided O
by O
selected O
candidates O
who O
have O
received O
have O
passed O
phone O
screening O
& O
or O
accepted O
verbal O
offers O
of O
employment O
. O

Boomi O
is O
the O
middle O
ware O
between O
success O
factor O
and O
sterling O
systems O
. O

Boomi O
sender O
interface O
picks O
up O
the O
profiles O
from O
SF O
and O
send O
to O
sterling O
for O
background O
verification O
. O

After O
receiving O
request O
from O
boomi O
sterling O
will O
send O
synchronous O
response O
with O
an O
Oder O
number O
, O
which O
will O
be O
updated O
to O
SF O
synchronously O
. O

After O
some O
time O
boomi O
receiver O
process O
( O
listener O
process O
) O
receives O
the O
asynchronous O
results O
from O
sterling O
which O
are O
updated O
back O
to O
SF O
. O

Role O
and O
responsibilities O
: O
• O
Requirement O
analysis O
. O

• O
Design O
as O
per O
the O
requirement O
. O

• O
Process O
development O
as O
per O
design O
. O

• O
Unit O
testing O
the O
applications O
. O

Project O
02 O
: O
Concur O
Invoicing O
Concur O
Invoicing O
is O
an O
on O
- O
demand O
, O
Web O
- O
based O
A O
/ O
P O
application O
that O
will O
be O
implemented O
to O
automate O
the O
invoice O
approval O
and O
payment O
process O
. O

The O
application O
captures O
vendor O
/ O
supplier O
invoice O
data O
, O
and O
delivers O
workflow O
and O
approval O
capabilities O
not O
currently O
implemented O
in O
the O
SunSystems O
AP O
module O
. O

The O
intent O
is O
to O
decrease O
potential O
fraud O
and O
mistakes O
, O
while O
increasing O
control O
, O
compliance O
and O
visibility O
into O
invoice O
payment O
The O
proposed O
Concur O
Invoicing O
( O
workflow O
) O
solution O
should O
accomplish O
the O
following O
business O
objectives O
: O
Automate O
the O
current O
procure O
- O
to O
- O
pay O
process O
; O
Deliver O
an O
online O
solution O
capable O
of O
providing O
a O
vehicle O
for O
employees O
to O
enter O
invoices O
, O
route O
them O
for O
approval O
and O
remind O
approvers O
when O
time O
has O
elapsed O
for O
approval O
; O
Provide O
a O
workflow O
whereby O
Axis O
management O
can O
approve O
invoices O
; O
Allow O
for O
the O
automatic O
monitoring O
of O
policies O
; O
Provide O
accounting O
information O
to O
the O
Sun O
GL O
for O
all O
A O
/ O
P O
transactions O
; O
Monitor O
compliance O
to O
corporate O
policy O
and O
budget O
guidelines O
; O
Improve O
A O
/ O
P O
process O
efficiencies O
( O
as O
compared O
to O
the O
current O
manual O
process O
) O
; O
Provide O
the O
creation O
of O
Purchase O
Orders O
for O
the O
Information O
Technology O
department O
. O

Senior B-Designation
GIS I-Designation
Consultant L-Designation
Infosys O
Technology O
Ltd O
- O
January O
2009 O
to O
March O

Team O

Responsibilities O

• O

• O

2002 O
The O
project O
involves O
development O
of O
the O
.NET O

components O
to O
enable O
Microsoft O
applications O
and O
data O
warehouse O
connectivity O
with O
the O
leading O
LOB O
Apps O
. O

The O
first O
phase O
of O
the O
project O
will O
be O
a O
proof O
of O
concept O
where O
.NET O

components O
are O
developed O
to O
integrate O
and O
enable O
two O
- O
way O
communications O
between O
Microsoft O
BI O
/ O
DW O
applications O
with O
Siebel O
Application O
assist B-Designation
Claim I-Designation
handler L-Designation
Reinsurance O
Claim O
WorkStation O
( O
RCWS O
) O
- O
2001 O
to O
2001 O
RCWS O
application O
is O
intended O
to O
improve O
the O
Claim O
's O
Business O
process O
through O
process O
improvement O
and O
automation O
. O

This O
application O
is O
designed O
to O
assist B-Designation
Claim I-Designation
handler L-Designation
to O
record O
the O
loss O
and O
reduce O
their O
dependency O
on O
the O
existing O
IRIS O
application O
. O

User O
is O
using O
IRIS O
application O
to O
record O
the O
Claims O
which O
does O
not O
support O
claim O
recording O
at O
loss O
level O
this O
cause O
duplication O
of O
General O
loss O
information O
. O

The O
main O
objective O
of O
this O
application O
is O
to O
provide O
a O
rich O
user O
interface O
where O
user O
can O
get O
all O
possible O
information O
and O
the O
fields O
to O
record O
the O
loss O
. O

Various O
summary O
tables O
and O
automated O
calculations O
will O
assist O
user O
to O
record O
the O
claim O
/ O
loss O
in O
more O
efficient O
manner O
. O

On O
technical O
front O
this O
application O
is O
based O
on O
BPM O
- O
SOA O
based O
architecture O
and O
it O
also O
provides O
integration O
with O
various O
enterprise O
systems O
like O
IRIS O
, O
RWS O
and O
CAT O
DB O
. O

This O
integration O
makes O
user O
task O
faster O
and O
easier O
. O

Project O
01 O
: O
Klondike O
( O
Business O
Data O
integration O
& O
Datawarehouse O
Solution O
) O
Klondike O
is O
an O
endeavor O
of O
Microsoft O
Business O
Intelligence O
group O
to O
provide O
data O
warehousing O
solution O
that O
is O
integrated O
with O
Biz O
# O
, O
Share O
point O
portal O
and O
Microsoft O
Excel O
to O
supply O
decision O
making O
system O
with O
slice O
and O
dice O
reports O
. O

This O
solution O
enables O
decision O
makers O
to O
have O
a O
complete O
view O
of O
their O
business O
in O
their O
own O
terms O
. O

This O
project O
provides O
solution O
to O
problems O
like O
Business O
data O
being O
spread O
across O
different O
systems O
, O
different O
systems O
having O
proprietary O
access O
methods O
, O
different O
semantics O
etc O
, O
reference O
data O
being O
inconsistent O
across O
different O
systems O
, O
transactional O
systems O
being O
highly O
granular O
/ O
detail O
oriented O
, O
often O
highly O
customized O
, O
changing O
over O
time O
, O
lagging O
behind O
changing O
view O
of O
business O
. O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O
. O

Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O
. O

Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O
. O

Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O
. O

Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O
. O

This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O
. O

Achievements O
: O
• O

a O
performance O
certificates O
and O
given O
a O
bonus O
for O
outstanding O
performance O

Onsite O
opportunity O
for O
supporting O
the O
production O
and O
DR O
environment O
at O
Saudi O
Arabia O

Project O
Details O
UG O
PROJECT O
TITLE O
: O
Memory O
Bounded O
Anytime O
Heuristic O
Search O
A O
* O
Algorithm O
➢ O
This O
Project O
presents O
a O
heuristic O
- O
search O
algorithm O
called O
Memory O
- O
bounded O
Anytime O
Window O
A O
* O
( O
MAWA O
* O
) O
, O
which O
is O
complete O
, O
anytime O
, O
and O
memory O
bounded O
. O

MAWA O
* O
uses O
the O
window O
- O
bounded O
anytime O
- O
search O
methodology O
of O
AWA O
* O
as O
the O
basic O
framework O
and O
combines O
it O
with O
the O
memory- O
bounded O
A O
* O
-like O
approach O
to O
handle O
restricted O
memory O
situations O
. O

Simple O
and O
efficient O
versions O
of O
MAWA O
* O
targeted O
for O
tree O
search O
have O
also O
been O
presented O
. O

Experimental O
results O
of O
the O
sliding O
- O
tile O
puzzle O
problem O
and O
the O
traveling O
- O
salesman O
problem O
show O
the O
significant O
advantages O
of O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
over O
existing O
methods O
. O

TITLE O
: O
Memory O
Bounded O
Anytime O

Search O
A O
* O
Algorithm O

Anytime O

* O

is O

anytime O
, O
and O
memory O
bounded O
. O

MAWA O
* O

window O
- O
bounded O
anytime O
- O
search O
methodology O
of O
AWA O
* O

the O
basic O

the O
memory- O
bounded O
A O
* O
-like O
approach O
to O
handle O
restricted O
memory O

. O

This O

. O

At O
first O

changed O

page O
screen O
of O
the O
client O

. O

After O
the O

of O
that O
we O
incorporated O
flex O
in O
to O
the O
account O
section O

. O

This O

from O
DataBase O
is O
taken O
by O
the O
flex O
using O
a O

procedure O
call O
and O

data O
is O

to O

. O

With O

of O
Advanced O
Data O

, O

) O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O
which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O
Banking O
Supervision O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O
create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O
how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O
risks O
banks O
face O
. O

In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O
and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O
appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O
. O

The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O
requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O
. O

For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O
( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O
Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O
. O

If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O
approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O
. O

Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O
. O

: O

9i O

Engine O
. O

A O

would O
bid O
for O
their O
SKU O
and O
engine O
would O
pick O

. O

engine O
. O

can O

multiple O

from O
multiple O
buyers O
. O

The O

of O
boxes O
in O

according O
to O

. O

Description O
: O
CBIL O
( O

) O
is O
a O

layer O
that O
is O

due O
to O
multiple O

across O
different O
core O
banking O
systems O
to O

easy O
integration O
with O
other O
global O
systems O
. O

to O
standardize O
all O
interfaces O
with O
core O
banking O
without O

, O

PROJECT O
TITLE O
: O
Memory O
Bounded O
Anytime O
Heuristic O
Search O
A O
* O
Algorithm O
➢ O
This O
Project O
presents O
a O
heuristic O
- O
search O
algorithm O
called O
Memory O
- O
bounded O
Anytime O
Window O
A*(MAWA O
* O
) O
, O
which O
is O
complete O
, O
anytime O
, O
and O
memory O
bounded O
. O

MAWA O
* O
uses O
the O
window- O
bounded O
anytime O
- O
search O
methodology O
of O
AWA O
* O
as O
the O
basic O
framework O
and O
combines O
it O
with O
the O
memory O
- O
bounded O
A O
* O
-like O
approach O
to O
handle O
restricted O
memory O
situations O
. O

Simple O
and O
efficient O
versions O
of O

* O
targeted O
for O

search O

. O

- O

proposed O
algorithm O

existing O
methods O
. O
